availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: R. H. Conner (Bath County, Kentucky, attorney, clerk, and soldier.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, attorney, clerk, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Juelda Lee Conner in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1849. Father of Clement Conner, Alexander Conner, James L. Conner, Kate Conner, Richard H. Conner, and Robert L. Conner. Attorney in Bath County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Clerk of the Bath County Court from 1851 to 1861. Attorney in Bath County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from September 22, 1862.
